text: [Music]
you guys remember when I made my frist
rata right that frittata with bread
cubes in it well today I'm making a
breakfast sandwich frittata using pita
instead of the bread cubes and it's just
as fun and just as delicious start by
cracking 5 eggs and whisking them I also
have a couple slices of bacon that I've
cut up and that's cooking right now just
a little bit to get crisp to your eggs
add a quarter cup of heavy cream and a
quarter cup of milk
I've already combined those in my
measuring cup a little bit of cayenne
pepper like an eighth of a teaspoon or a
pinch that's optional I guess if you
don't want it and then some mix chopped
up fresh herbs a couple tablespoons I'm
using a combination of chervil parsley
and chives make sure that your herbs
have been well washed and then well dry
wet herbs are almost as bad as gritty
herbs but maybe not quite as bad add
your herbs straight to the egg mixture
and then I have 2/3 of a cup of grated
cheese you can use like a sharp cheddar
or Gruyere anything that you like
I'm gonna add half of it to the egg
mixture and then half is gonna get
sprinkled on later okay I'm all set with
this I'm gonna get the bacon out of the
skillet my bacon is crisp it's been
cooking for about seven minutes take it
out and you can add the bacon directly
to your egg mixture season with salt and
pepper
I have a little bit of extra fat in here
from cooking the bacon and I'm gonna
pour off almost all of it I'm gonna
leave about a teaspoon in the pan
pitas been split in half and you just
want to cook it until it gets toasted on
both sides it's a couple minutes per
side in the bacon fat and you do that to
each one individually because this is a
a 10-inch skillet and there's not enough
room in here to toast your pitas
together so you have to do it in batches
when it's golden brown on the first side
give it a turn you want to get it nice
and crispy because you want it crispy
inside of the eggs as its cooking first
one is done you can do the same thing to
the second one you can add a little more
bacon fat pan got a little hot but
that's okay just adjust your heat turn
it over now you can add the eggs have
your I've been preheating to 425 degrees
because you're gonna start this on top
of the stove and then you're gonna
finish in the oven pour your egg mixture
right over the PITA and then stir it a
bit just to start the cooking process
this is a nonstick skillet so you
shouldn't have to worry about sticking
especially with all that bacon fat this
is a 10-inch skillet but you could do
this in an 8-inch skillet too and you'll
have a thicker result I like to cook my
eggs on top of the stove a little bit
before I add it in the oven I also think
that makes them fluffier when you're
cooking and stirring sort of allowing
the egg to run underneath it makes for a
fluffier result now what you want to do
is after you've cooked it just a little
bit on top of the stove put the other
piece of pita down on top cut side down
and put it into the oven it's gonna cook
for a total of 16 minutes but after 8
minutes you're gonna sprinkle with the
remaining cheese voila
doesn't that look pretty I think I'm
gonna slide it out onto a cutting board
to cut it yeah tada
come and cut yourself a slice I can
barely wait I think it's probably too
hot to eat but yeah
you want to make this into a great lunch
make a nice salad serve it on the side
and enjoy
